Australia's deadliest-ever terror attack targets Jewish community and kills 15
subhead: The two assailants, a 50-year-old man who was killed during the attack and his 24-year-old son, targeted Hanukkah celebrations on Bondi Beach in Sydney on Saturday. Intelligence services had investigated the younger suspect in 2019. Antisemitic acts have surged in the country since October 7, 2023.

Louvre Museum closes as workers go on strike
subhead: Disappointed visitors were turned away at the Louvre in Paris on Monday as staff at the world's most visited museum went on strike over working conditions and other grievances. The strike comes two months after a burglary that underlined security failures at the museum.

title: Zelensky and European leaders seek US commitment to deter Russia from attacking Ukraine
subhead: On Monday, the Ukrainian president was scheduled to meet with two US envoys, Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, before continuing discussions with European leaders, including Britain's Keir Starmer and Emmanuel Macron.

title: Director Rob Reiner and wife found dead in Los Angeles, police launch investigation
subhead: American directer Rob Reiner and his wife were found dead at their home in the Brentwood neighborhood of Los Angeles on Sunday. Police said a homicide investigation was underway and media reported the couple had been found dead of apparent stab wounds.

title: France's new cocaine users are everyday men and women
subhead: Contrary to what the French president has previously claimed, cocaine use now extends far beyond wealthy city-center elites.

War in Ukraine: 'The EU has too few cards to hesitate over playing the financial one'
subhead: The 27 member states must soon decide the fate of €210 billion in assets belonging to Moscow. Marginalized in peace negotiations, the European Union now has the chance to assert its influence in resolving the conflict, argues Le Monde columnist Stéphane Lauer.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'The true enemy of the nationalist and extractivist right embodied by Trumpists is the global social-democratic left'
subhead: The year 2025 was marked by the shock of Donald Trump's return to the White House. An unprecedented wave of extreme brutality has shaken the world like never since 1945, observes the economist in his column.

title: Franco-German children of war's endless search for their roots
subhead: In France, between 1941 and 1945, around 200,000 children are estimated to have been born from a union between a French woman and a German soldier. Their often painful search for their origins meets many obstacles, including family taboos and difficult access to archives.
